item.title: 瑞士能源交易商 MET 寻求收购立陶宛 Achema 54% 的股份
item.description: 瑞士能源贸易商和生产商 MET 集团计划收购立陶宛化肥生产商 Achema 集团的大部分股份，该集团是波罗的海国家最大的公司之一。【原文：Swiss energy trader and producer MET Group plans to buy a majority stake in Lithuanian fertilizer producer Achema Group, one of the Baltic nation’s biggest companies.】

item.title: 南非经常账户差额缩小幅度超过预期
item.description: 由于出口略有增长，而进口因需求下降而减少，南非第一季度经常账户赤字的收窄幅度超出预期。【原文：South Africa’s current-account shortfall narrowed more than expected in the first quarter as exports increased marginally and imports decreased due to lower demand.】

item.title: 交易激增，美国银行能源银行家迁往迪拜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着中东能源行业交易的蓬勃发展，美国银行公司的一位高级交易员将从伦敦调往迪拜。【原文：A senior Bank of America Corp. dealmaker is relocating from London to Dubai, according to people familiar with the matter, as transactions in the Middle Eastern energy industry boom.】

item.title: 小管道裂缝如何引发欧洲天然气市场恐慌
item.description: 挪威正在对一个天然气平台上的管道进行紧急维修，但这一事件严峻地提醒人们，小规模的故障也可能导致欧洲物价飞涨。【原文：Urgent repairs to a pipe on a gas platform in Norway are underway but the event served as a grim reminder that small outages can send European prices soaring.】

item.title: 英国电网预计冬季电力供应充足，但风险依然存在
item.description: 今年冬天，英国电网可能会有更大的缓冲空间来防范潜在的电力短缺，从而减少对备用电力供应的需求，帮助维持电力供应。【原文：The UK’s power grid will likely have a bigger buffer to guard against potential shortages this winter, reducing the need for backup supplies to help keep the lights on.】

item.title: 英国监管机构的汽车贷款审查使 S&U 贷款公司利润微薄
item.description: 英国汽车贷款公司 S&U Plc 公布第一季度盈利下滑，因为该国金融监管机构的审查继续对收款造成压力。该股盘中跌幅创四个月来最大。【原文：UK motor lender S&U Plc reported a slump in first-quarter earnings, as a review by the country’s financial regulator continues to weigh on collections. The shares had their biggest intraday decline in four months.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"成员国部长拒绝对石油增产作出消极反应
item.description: 欧佩克+"成员国的部长们拒绝了原油市场对欧佩克决定从 10 月份起逐步提高原油产量的看跌反应，并预测市场最终将看到该组织的政策是正确的。【原文：OPEC+ ministers rejected oil’s bearish reaction to its decision to gradually boost crude production from October and predicted the market will eventually see that the group’s policy is correct.】

item.title: Orsted 美洲首席执行官谈解决风力发电中的问题
item.description:
大卫-哈迪（David Hardy）：避免行业再次出现完美风暴。【原文：

David Hardy on avoiding another perfect storm for the industry.

】

item.title: 局外人能修好博格尔建造的房子吗？
item.description:
在本期《Trillions》节目中，我们将讨论萨利姆-拉姆吉（Salim Ramji）就任 Vanguard 首席执行官一事，以及他所面临的挑战。【原文：

On this episode of Trillions, we discuss Salim Ramji’s arrival as CEO of Vanguard, and the challenges he faces.

】

item.title: 瑞安航空在西班牙价值 100 亿欧元的 Covid 援助计划中败下阵来
item.description: 根据欧盟最高法院的一项判决，欧盟竞争执法机构批准西班牙设立 100 亿欧元（109 亿美元）的救助基金以支持受冠状病毒大流行影响的公司是正确的。【原文：The European Union’s competition enforcers were right to approve a €10 billion ($10.9 billion) Spanish bailout fund to support companies hit by the coronavirus pandemic, according to a judgment from the EU’s top court.】

item.title: 欧洲央行可能降息前欧洲股市上涨
item.description: 在欧洲央行决策者普遍预期降息之前，欧洲股市连续第二天扩大涨幅。【原文：European equities extended gains for a second day ahead of a widely expected interest-rate cut by European Central Bank policymakers.】

item.title: Trafigura 称铜价上涨缺乏基本面支撑
item.description: 特拉菲古拉集团（Trafigura Group —）认为，铜价最近创下的新高并不符合现实世界的供求关系；特拉菲古拉集团是全球最大的铜贸易商，通常也是市场上最看好铜价的声音之一。【原文：Copper’s recent surge to a record wasn’t justified by real-world supply and demand, according to Trafigura Group — the top copper trader and usually one of the market’s most bullish voices.】

item.title: 能源危机消退，托克集团半年利润下降 73
item.description: 随着大宗商品巨头适应其主要能源和金属市场较为平静的状况，创辉集团公布了自 2020 年以来最小的上半年利润（比去年同期下降 73%）。【原文：Trafigura Group posted its smallest first-half profit since 2020 — down 73% from a year earlier — as the commodity giant adjusts to calmer conditions across its key energy and metals markets.】

item.title: 土耳其航空公司在供应受阻的情况下投入零部件生产
item.description: 土耳其航空公司正在涉足包括座椅和发动机部件在内的飞机零部件制造领域，试图利用其巨额飞机订单刺激本国航空业的发展。【原文：Turkish Airlines is branching out into manufacturing of aircraft components including seats and engine parts as the carrier seeks to leverage its giant order book of planes to stimulate the homegrown aeronautics industry.】

item.title: Cathie Wood称尽管英伟达减持，但基金在人工智能领域布局良好
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）表示，方舟投资管理公司（Ark Investment Management）在人工智能资产方面布局良好，即使她的公司在去年英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Cathie Wood said Ark Investment Management is well positioned in artificial intelligence assets, even after her company trimmed back on Nvidia Corp. shares before the rally last year.】

item.title: 沙特称欧佩克+并未为追逐市场份额而改变政策
item.description: 沙特能源大臣阿卜杜勒阿齐兹-本-萨勒曼亲王说，欧佩克+并没有改变其石油政策，以谋求在全球市场上占有更大份额，仍然把稳定放在首位。【原文：OPEC+ hasn’t changed its oil policy to pursue a greater share of the global market and still prioritizes stability, said Saudi Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman.】

item.title: 无人机袭击俄罗斯南部新哈特金斯克炼油厂
item.description: 无人机袭击了俄罗斯南部靠近乌克兰边境的新哈特金斯克炼油厂，引发了工厂火灾。【原文：Drones attacked the Novoshakhtinsk refinery in southern Russia near the border with Ukraine, sparking a fire at the plant.】

item.title: 希腊银行获欧洲央行批准进行 2008 年危机以来的首次赔付
item.description: 欧洲中央银行批准了希腊主要银行今年支付股息的请求，这是 2008 年以来的第一次。【原文：The European Central Bank approved requests by Greece’s major banks to pay a dividend this year for the first time since 2008.】

item.title: 德国工厂订单下降，凸显持续困境
item.description: 德国 4 月份的工厂订单下降，这表明关键的制造业仍需努力才能与其他经济部门的发展势头相匹配。【原文：German factory orders fell in April — a sign that the key manufacturing sector still has a way to go to match the momentum building elsewhere in the economy.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数将进一步上涨
item.description: 英格兰银行（右）位于伦敦金融城的 Square Mile 金融区。摄影师：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：The Bank of England, right, in the Square Mile financial district in the City of London. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg】

item.title: 美联储盟友为何在 "D-Day "当天降息？
item.description:
继加拿大之后，欧洲央行有望迈出一大步。与此同时，"长期正常 "是否会成为新常态？【原文：

After Canada, the ECB is expected to take the big step. Meanwhile, is ‘normal for much longer’ the new normal?

】

item.title: 阿布扎比今年首次 IPO 吸引 200 亿美元订单
item.description: 阿布扎比今年的首次公开募股吸引了 200 亿美元的订单，这表明海湾地区对上市的渴望依然健康。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s first initial public offering of the year drew in orders of $20 billion as appetite for listings in the Gulf remains healthy.】

item.title: 降息押注创造今年最长债券连胜纪录
item.description: 全球政府债券创下自 12 月以来最长的连涨记录，因为全球市场一致认为今年会有更多的降息举措。【原文：Global government bonds posted their longest rising streak since December, as the worldwide pendulum of market consensus swings toward more interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 习近平呼吁加强与美国大学的交流以促进两国关系
item.description: 据官方新华社报道，中国国家主席习近平呼吁中美两国大学加强交流，增进相互了解。【原文：China’s President Xi Jinping has called for more exchanges between Chinese and American universities to boost mutual understanding, according to the official Xinhua News Agency.】

item.title: 以色列面临因加沙战争而失去哥伦比亚煤炭供应的风险
item.description: 哥伦比亚贸易部呼吁限制向以色列出售煤炭，这是随着以色列在加沙行动中死亡人数上升而孤立这个犹太国家的最新举措。【原文：Colombia’s trade ministry is calling for a restriction on coal sales to Israel in the latest bid to isolate the Jewish state as the death toll rises in its Gaza campaign.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 莫迪小胜加剧财政风险，印度央行可能按兵不动
item.description: 由于印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）领导的执政党在大选中获胜乏力，引发了人们对财政民粹主义的担忧，印度央行可能会在今年相当长的时间内继续按兵不动。【原文：India’s central bank will likely keep interest rates on hold well into this year as a weak election win for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ruling party fans fears of fiscal populism.】

item.title: 美国就业数据公布前，金属从四周低点反弹
item.description: 在美国就业数据公布之前，铜引领工业金属价格反弹。【原文：Copper led industrial metals in a price rally ahead of US jobs data, that should inform the Federal Reserve’s next moves on interest rates.】

item.title: 莫迪魔力帮助平息印度市场与大选有关的波动
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您提供可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件的每日摘要。【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a daily digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets.】

item.title: 台湾中央银行发出信号：通胀隐忧已逐渐消失
item.description: 台湾央行行长杨金龙（Yang Chin-long）表示，通胀对岛内经济的影响正在减弱。【原文：Taiwan central bank Governor Yang Chin-long indicated inflation is becoming less of a concern for the island’s economy, comments that come a week before a key decision on rates.】
